description.narrative: Capacity enhanced at state and district levels for planning, implementation, budgeting and public financial management for most disadvantaged children., which contributes to Adolescent Empowerment, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Human Rights Institutions, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Higher quality programmes through results-based management and improved accountability of results.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Capacity enhanced at state and district levels for planning, implementation, budgeting and public financial management for mostdisadvantaged children.

description.narrative: A SDG priorities-focused National Plan of Action for Children was finalised and released by the Central Government, with UNICEF's technical support. Child Rights' Resource Book developed for 36 State Protection of Child Rights Commissions and capacity building workshops provided the members with essential knowledge to enhance their functioning. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:15/01/2018

title.narrative: Availability of national plan of action and State plan of action taking forward recommendations of CRC report
Timely submission of government and civil society CRC reports

actual.value: 2017:India's CRC reports were all submitted on-time.

title.narrative: National Commission and no. of State Commissions that have a functional system* to address child rights violation {*(complaints mechanism, inspections, investigations, public hearings, summons procedures and monitoring mechanisms for RTE,JJA and Protection of Children from Sexual Offences, Act) }
